figure_2.title: Fig. 2.
figure_2.caption: Sample images of various types of skin cancer.

figure_3.title: Fig. 3.
figure_3.caption: (a) Bar graph illustrating the distribution of research papers published over the past 18 years that leverage ML, DL, hybrid, and multimodal approaches. Note that this is not an exhaustive collection, but a subset selected for this survey. (b) Pie chart illustrating the percentage distribution of papers based on ML, DL, hybrid, and multimodal approaches.

figure_4.title: Fig. 4.
figure_4.caption: Taxonomy of different skin cancer classification strategies used in this survey.

figure_5.title: Fig. 5.
figure_5.caption: (a) Flowchart of the skin cancer classification system proposed by Waheed et al.58; (b) Structure of the hybrid GA-ANN classifier proposed by Aswin et al.85.

figure_6.title: Fig. 6.
figure_6.caption: (a) Pie chart illustrating the percentage distribution of papers based on different DL models. (b) Pie chart illustrating the percentage distribution of papers based on various CNN-based techniques.

figure_7.title: Fig. 7.
figure_7.caption: Architecture of the SkinNet-8 model proposed by Fahad et al.110.

figure_8.title: Fig. 8.
figure_8.caption: Overview of the soft attention unit proposed by Datta et al.130.

figure_9.title: Fig. 9.
figure_9.caption: (a) Block diagram of the GAN-based model proposed by Bisla et al.155; (b) Architecture of the DCGAN proposed by Bisla et al.155.

figure_10.title: Fig. 10.
figure_10.caption: Overview of the hybrid model proposed by Tembhurne et al.184.

claims.sentence: Figure 1 illustrates the categorization of skin cancer into different types and Fig. 2 presents images for each of these types.

Open in a new tab
Types of skin cancer.Fig. 2.
In Fig. 3a, we present the distribution illustrating the count of research papers across these methodologies over almost 18 years, totalling 95 identified papers.

Note that this is not an exhaustive collection, but a subset selected for this survey. (b) Pie chart illustrating the percentage distribution of papers based on ML, DL, hybrid, and multimodal approaches.As evident from Fig. 3a, with the advent of deep neural networks, there has been an escalating trend in the number of research articles published over the years, with a notable surge observed in 2018.

Figure 3b depicts a pie chart illustrating the proportions of research papers using different computer vision-based strategies, with deep learning methodologies forming a significant portion of this survey.
The taxonomy of the different strategies is shown in Fig. 4.
The flowchart of this system is shown in Fig. 5a.
The structure of the hybrid GA-ANN classifier is shown in Fig. 5b.
Figure 6a presents a pie chart illustrating the proportions of research papers based on various DL models.
Figure 6b presents a pie chart illustrating the proportions of papers using various CNN-based techniques.
Figure 7 shows the architecture of SkinNet-8.
Figure 8 depicts the overview of this soft attention unit.
Figure 9a,b depict the block diagram of this system and the architecture of the DCGAN model, respectively.
Figure 10 depicts the overview of this model.
